metaData.descriptionCS: The child is presented two words that represent common objects or concepts and describes how they are similar.

questions.title: Sample Item. Three-Four
questions.correctInstructionsHTML:
Correct response [any response with the word numbers]:

Say, That’s right. Three and four are both numbers. Let’s try some more.
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect response [any response without the word numbers]:

Say, That’s not quite right. Three and four are both numbers. Let’s try some more.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say, In what way are THREE and FOUR alike? How are they the same?

answers.html: Any response with the word numbers

questions.title: †Item 1. Red-Green
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are RED and GREEN alike?

answers.html: Green is dark and red is light
Colors of (flags, uniforms); [Provides any response with the word color]

questions.title: †Item 2. Milk-Water
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are MILK and WATER alike?

answers.html: Come in (cups, glasses, bottles, jugs, cartons)
At the store; Things you buy; Groceries
Drinks; Things you drink; Drink them
For when you’re thirsty; Quench thirst

questions.title: Item 3. Grapes-Apples
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are GRAPES and APPLES alike?

answers.html: Snacks; Desserts; Lunch; Breakfast; Goodies; Treats

questions.title: Item 4. Shirt-Shoe
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are a SHIRT and a SHOE alike?

answers.html: (Wear, Dress up in, Dress in) them

questions.title: †Item 5. Butterfly-Bee
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are a BUTTERFLY and a BEE alike?

answers.html: Flowers; (Like, Sit on, Stop on) flowers

questions.title: †Item 6. Horse-Cow
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are a HORSE and a COW alike?

answers.html: Live on a farm; On the farm
You (raise, feed, care for, [names shared activity]) them
Things with (tails, hair, fur, eyes, four legs, [names shared feature])
Things that (sleep, eat grass, walk, graze, make noises, [names shared behavior])

questions.title: Item 7. Brother-Sister
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are a BROTHER and a SISTER alike?

answers.html: They (help, care for, play with, take care of, protect) me
They (fix dinner, help with homework, drive me places)
They (fight, love, like) each other; They love me
They look (similar, alike, the same); Twins
Both have a body; [Names common feature of humans]
Live (with each other, in the same house)
People that (help, care for, play with, take care of, protect) me
People that (fix dinner, help with homework, drive me places)
They share the same (genes, chromosomes, blood)
Family; Family members; Immediate family members
People who are related to you

questions.title: †Item 8. Winter-Summer
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are WINTER and SUMMER alike?

answers.html: Fun; Can go outside and play in them
Part of Spring, Summer, Winter, Fall; [Provides all four seasons]
(Time, Part, Category) of the year with different (weather, temperatures)

questions.title: †Item 9. Angry-Happy
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are ANGRY and HAPPY alike?

answers.html: (How, Ways) you are; Things you (can be, are)
Things in your body; Things on your mouth
Facial expressions; (Looks, Things that show) on your face; Faces
Mental (conditions, states); The way you feel mentally; Inner states
How you feel; Ways you can feel

questions.title: Item 10. Sour-Salty
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are SOUR and SALTY alike?

answers.html: Sweet; Salty; Sour; Bitter; Sour and bitter; [Provides fewer than four taste zones]
Too much of them is bad
Too much can be (bad for you, unhealthy)
Food; Things you eat; Eat both
Sweet, salty, sour, and bitter; [Provides all four taste zones]
Things that make your mouth water; Things you crave
Tastes; Things you taste; Taste them; Taste (good, bad)
How things feel on your (tongue, taste buds)
Things that (tongues, taste buds) can (sense, detect)
Food characteristics; Ways you can (talk about, describe) food

questions.title: Item 11. Truck-Train
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are a TRUCK and a TRAIN alike?

answers.html: Automobiles; Cars; [Names a type of vehicle]
Things you ride in; You ride them
Things that (take, carry) you to (places, school, work, the store)
Things you ride in to go to (places, school, work, the store)
Things that (you, people, things, cargo) travel in to other places

questions.title: Item 12. Blocks-Clay
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are BLOCKS and CLAY alike?

answers.html: Make (towers, buildings, [names specific construction]) with them
(Create, Make) things with them; Used to (create, make) things

questions.title: Item 13. Knee-Ankle
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are a KNEE and an ANKLE alike?

answers.html: Round; Curved; Pointed; Hard; Covered with skin
Things that (break, get broken, get hurt)
Body parts; (Attached to, Part of, On) your body
Help you (move, walk); (Move, Walk) with them
Joints; Jointed; Body parts with joints
Where your bones join up; Holds parts of your leg together
Body parts that (bend, flex, are flexible); Places where you bend a limb
Work like (hinges, a ball-and-socket); Both pivot

questions.title: Item 14. Thermometer-Timer
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are a THERMOMETER and a TIMER alike?

answers.html: Use them to see how (hot, cold) something is; [Vague reference to measuring temperature]
Use them to see how much time has passed; [Vague reference to measuring time]
They’re in (schools, kitchens, science class, lab); [No reference to use]
Use them to see how long you have left
Use them to see how much there is of something; [Provides vague reference to measuring]
Both tell you if your food is done cooking
Use to keep track of something; (Get, Give, Take) readings
You use them to measure things

questions.title: Item 15. Ice-Steam
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are ICE and STEAM alike?

answers.html: Water; Made of water; Created from water
(Stages, Phases, Forms) of water; (Water, H<sub>2</sub>O, Hydrogen and oxygen) in different (forms, states)
Same (molecular, elemental, chemical) structure at different temperatures

questions.title: Item 16. River-Mountain
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are a RIVER and a MOUNTAIN alike?

answers.html: Outside; In the (forest, country, valley, wilderness)
Places on land; Part of the (Earth, land, world)
Part of (nature, the environment, the wilderness)
Can cross both; Travel across them
Formed by (nature, glaciers, plate movement, erosion)
Physical features of the (Earth, land, world)
(Geographical, Natural) boundaries; Barriers in crossing (land, terrain)

questions.title: Item 17. Demand-Request
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are a DEMAND and a REQUEST alike?

answers.html: Ask for something; (Tell, Ask, Command) somebody to do something
Things people (want, need, desire); Wants; Needs; Desires
Things your (parent, teacher, boss, [names specific person]) (says, does) to get you to do things
(Ways, Methods) to get (compliance, cooperation, assistance, help, people to do things)
(Ways, Methods) to get something you (want, need, desire)
Things you say to get people to do things
Ways you express your (wants, needs, desires)

questions.title: Item 18. Light-Sound
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are LIGHT and SOUND alike?

answers.html: Learn about them in (science class, school)
They (travel, move) quickly; Both are speeds
You can turn them on and off
(Move, Travel) in waves; They (have wavelengths, are waves)
(Perceive, Observe, Detect) them through your senses
Reflect; Can reflect off of things
Can be absorbed; Things can absorb them

questions.title: Item 19. Luck-Practice
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are LUCK and PRACTICE alike?

answers.html: (Make you, Require you to) do (things, something)
If you practice, you might get lucky
Help you (perform, do) better; Make you better at what you do
Help you (pass tests, win games, get a job, get first chair, [provides specific positive outcome])
Help you get what you want; Help you
(Affect, Influence) outcomes; Influence whether you (win, lose)
Can improve chances of (doing well, succeeding); Can improve your odds of success
(Involved in, Lead to, Contribute to, Play a role in, Affect) (outcomes, how things turn out, whether you win or lose)

questions.title: Item 20. Allow-Prevent
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are ALLOW and PREVENT alike?

answers.html: Restrictions; Restrain your activities; (Set, Put) limits; [Emphasis on prevent]
Can’t have one without the other
Things you (earn, ask for, are told)
Tell you what you (can, can’t) do
Affect your ability to do something
Have to do with (behavior, actions); Consequences of behavior
Expectations of what you are to do; Set expectations
Set ranges for (what you can do, how we behave)
Rules; Laws; Regulations; Levels of freedom
Tell you what you can and can’t do

questions.title: Item 21. Shadow-Fingerprint
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are a SHADOW and a FINGERPRINT alike?

answers.html: Help you figure out who the (suspect, person) is
Things (you, people) leave; Things you (leave, left) behind
Ways to know someone (was, is, has been) there
(Can, Can't) see them in bright light
Used to (identify people, tell who you are)
Traces; Marks; Signs; Clues; Evidence; Indicators
Ways to (see yourself, show your body)
(Images, Outlines, Silhouettes) of (an object, someone, something there, something real, a presence, a form, a shape)
(Traces, Marks, Signs, Clues, Evidence, Indicators) of (an object, someone, something there, something real, a presence, a form, a shape)
(Products, Outputs, Results, Effects) of (an object, someone, something there, something real, a presence, a form, a shape)
Show a distorted shape of the original

questions.title: Item 22. Reality-Dream
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are REALITY and a DREAM alike?

answers.html: Affect your life; Involve your future
How (true, factual, false, fictitious) something seems
Live in both; Ways you can live
Mind-sets; Ways people perceive the world
(Happen, Occur, Represented, Processed) in your (brain, mind)

questions.title: Item 23. Space-Time
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what way are SPACE and TIME alike?

answers.html: Limited; Things you run out of
Abstract; Not physical; Can’t be (seen, touched)
(Fabric of, Help to define) the universe

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: Subtest requires 3 consecutive scores of 0 points

reverseRule.noSkipMsg: If suspected of having an intellectual disability or low cognitive ability
If suspected of having an intellectual disability or low cognitive ability
